Our Team

    Caroline Simon

    Caroline is a Public Health Science major and Spanish Language and Cultures minor from Woodbine, MD. She loves being a part of the University of Maryland community through Public Health Without Borders, Pre-medical Society, and Alzheimer’s research. Caroline loves being outside, volunteering, and spending time with her family and friends.

    Daniel Reisfeld

    Daniel Reisfeld is studying to be a civil engineering major with a focus in traffic and project management at the University of Maryland. From Baltimore County, Maryland, he is actively involved on campus in Engineering without borders, Primmanum Honor Society, and American Society of Civil Engineers.

    Myles Arrington

    Myles Arrington is from Upper Marlboro, MD in Prince George’s County, and is pursuing a degree in psychology and has plans to double major with biology. His interests include playing and watching basketball and organizations like Cru and Black Student Union. With Team WALK, Myles is particularly excited to gain more experience working with 3D printing technology and seeing the real-life applications of how the team’s research can help benefit the lives of those in the community of metropolitan areas.

    Saul Schaffer

    Saul is currently seeking a B.S in Mechanical Engineering. He serves as a Resident Assistant in Ellicott Hall and is a member of Theta Tau, the professional engineering fraternity. In his free time, Saul enjoys biking, hiking, listening to audiobooks and watching movies.

    Edward Nusinovich

    Edward is an Applied Mathematics major. He is a former employee of the United States Nuclear Regulatory Commission and a current research fellow at the National Institute of Standards and Technology. A big lover of software development, Edward is the author and maintainer of the MatPy materials design project, and a member of the Robotics @ Maryland team.

    Damiaan Radstake

    Damiaan Radstake is a University of Maryland student majoring in civil and environmental engineering, following the water resources and environmental track. His research interests include the environment and many other developing fields such as 3-D printing and robotics. He hopes to learn a lot from this research project and hopes to enhance the field of biomechanics through his contributions.

    Manaahil Rao

    Manaahil Rao is an aspiring bioengineer at the University of Maryland College Park. She is currently enrolled in a minor in technology entrepreneurship in hopes of eventually implementing her bioengineering knowledge. She is also a member of Engineers Without Borders and the Society of Women Engineers. As a member of Team WALK, Manaahil hopes to develop an inexpensive and safe prosthetic alternative for adolescents with limb loss and their families.

    Sarah Bank

    Sarah Bank is a mechanical engineering major. She enjoys environmental science and is excited to learn more about 3D printing. She loves animals and will always get excited about seeing a dog on the sidewalk. In her spare time, she likes to watch TV shows, draw, and listen to music.
